intro: [WRONG START] Nothopapanax diversifolius, commonly known as the variable-leaf pterostemon, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which often exhibit significant variation in shape and size across different parts of the plant. The species belongs to the family Araliaceae and is known for its attractive, often fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
